Algorithms for Supervised- and Unsupervised Learning

This document provides an overview of various algorithms used in supervised and unsupervised learning, including k-nearest neighbor, naive Bayes, and Gaussian likelihood. It explains the model objective, training, regularization, complexity, and online learning capabilities of each algorithm.

Key Concepts:

  • K-Nearest Neighbour Algorithm
  • Naive Bayes Classification
  • Multivariate Likelihood
  • Multinomial Likelihood
  • Gaussian Likelihood
k-nearest neighbour Bayes' rule Naive Bayes Multivariate likelihood Multinomial likelihood
